DataElement.preferredName: Caries Occlusal Surface Margin Dental Pulp Wall Maximum Depth Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the determination of the size or magnitude of the largest possible quantity as related to depth of margin of the biting surfaces of the premolar and molar teeth to the pulp (a richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin) wall or floor for in which the tooth that has become softened, discolored, and/or porous.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Caries Occlusal Surface Margin Dental Pulp Wall Depth
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to depth of margin of the biting surfaces of the premolar and molar teeth to the pulp (a richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin) wall or floor for in which the tooth that has become softened, discolored, and/or porous.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

Concepts.definition: The decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

Property.preferredName: Occlusal Surface Margin Dental Pulp Wall Depth
Property.preferredDefinition: The biting surfaces of the premolar and molar teeth.:Margin; the boundary line or the area immediately inside the boundary.:A richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin. It has formative, nutritive, sensory, and protective functions.:A layer of material that encloses space or that encloses a structure.:Depth; extent downward or inward.

Concepts.definition: The biting surfaces of the premolar and molar teeth.
A boundary line or the area immediately inside the boundary.

A richly vascularized and innervated connective tissue of mesodermal origin contained in the central cavity of a tooth and delimited by the dentin. It has formative, nutritive, sensory, and protective functions.
A layer of material that encloses space or that encloses a structure.
The extent downward or inward; the perpendicular measurement from the surface downward to determine deepness.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the determination of the size or magnitude of the largest possible quantity to the extent downward or inward of decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: the largest possible quantity or degree.:Depth; extent downward or inward.:Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: The largest possible quantity or degree.
The extent downward or inward; the perpendicular measurement from the surface downward to determine deepness.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
